title: Man killed by OC Transpo bus on Russell Road | CBC News
text:
A man was struck and killed by an OC Transpo bus in east Ottawa Tuesday morning, paramedics have confirmed.

Ottawa police said the man was struck at Russell Road and Southvale Crescent N. around 7:55 a.m.

"Bystanders initiated CPR and tried quite aggressively to resuscitate the male, who was in cardiac arrest," said paramedic spokesperson Marc-Antoine Deschamps.

"They were relieved by paramedics and firefighters, and despite the best efforts of everybody on scene, he was pronounced dead on scene."

Marc-Antoine Deschamps, with Ottawa paramedics, said bystanders tried to resuscitate the male pedestrian but he was later pronounced dead at the scene. 0:32

Russell Road was closed to through traffic from Walkley Road to St. Laurent Boulevard. It reopened in the afternoon.
description: A man was struck and killed by an OC Transpo bus in east Ottawa Tuesday morning, paramedics have confirmed.
